name: The Midtown Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is an overexpensive dive. The air doesn't cool the rooms as its on or off those are the two settings. The beds are old and uncomfortable, the decor came from the 70's, the pool had green mold all over the walls. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: This hotel is old and a dive

reviews.text: We stayed at The Midtown Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of September and I can't fault the property.
reviews.title: Great property - fantastic location

reviews.text: It was easy to locate from the T stops nearby - and really convenient to access all the sights of Boston.
reviews.title: Loved the Midtown
Great experience for the budget minded traveler
reviews.text: The rooms were really spacious with a huge comfortable bed, plenty of spare pillows and blankets if you needed them, and a compact but clean bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were wonderfully helpful - accommodating every request with politeness.
reviews.title: Good location and cheap

reviews.text: The layout of this hotel is a bit of a trip in time. It has a very long halls and is very low (looks like 2-3 stories high), like an old-school motel. There is even an outdoor pool in an enclosed courtyard, surrounded by floor-to-cieling windows and carpeted (that's right) floor. The style of the hotel sign kind of says it all. But if this is discouraging to you, it shouldn't be. Aside from the fact that there are steps (?!) leading to the first floor hall, everything else about the place is comfortable and modern enough. The room layouts may be weird (small bathroom with door separating it from the sink; no full length mirror), but the furniture is well maintained, the carpet is impeccable, the bedding is comfortable, and there is ample storage space. The room was also huge, even by American standards. Oh! And the windows open.
reviews.title: Simply welcome: Good value, friendly service

reviews.text: The hotel has no in-house restaurant or room service but they recommend a great café down the street and the keys advertise a dine-in service.
reviews.title: Musty Smelly Hotel

reviews.text: My complaints were: a noisy vending machine above my room which made me request a change; the tub didn't drain well; the bathroom fan didn't seem to work.
reviews.title: Great location, great city stay

reviews.text: Above average: the friendly staff (90% of them anyway), and the proximity to the Hynes Convention Center at a comparatively super low price in relation to other properties in the area.
reviews.title: Great value for us, NO complaints.

reviews.text: Staying at this Hotel, worst part of the trip! The room had a very Musty smell to it. You can hear your neighbors as if they were staying in the room with you. Bathrooms need to be updated. The average guest must be about 5 feet tall since, the bed was not long enough and the shower head was at eye level and I am not quite six feet tall. The pool area is very dirty, the pool towels were thrown in a pile on the ground. Not too pleased with the weekend staff! The price is great but, if you want to be nickeled and dime for everything else stay here. Cheap ...cheap...cheap! Did I say Cheap?
reviews.title: A good value-for-money option in a well-located area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a 3 day stay at the Midtown Hotel in Boston recently. We picked the hotel for it excellent location, and it didn't dissapoint.
reviews.title: Basic, great location

reviews.text: It's around the corner from 2 "T" stops, and within walking distance of the city centre, as well as the Cambridge area.
reviews.title: ok basic hotel in central location

likes.disliked: — basic decor and no luxury feel, annoying stairs on way to lift for luggage!

reviews.text: Apart from the location the hotel itself is functional, rather than exceptional. The staff are friendly, and the hotel is clean and has all the facilities you'd need. It could do with a refurb though, as it looks like it's not been updated since the 80's! Also on our first night we ended up in a very noisy room at the very back of the hotel. When we complained we were promptly moved to a new room nearer to the lobby area, which was much less noisy albeit it somewhat smaller.
reviews.title: Good location,thats about all

reviews.text: The rooms are clean, spaceous and have all the usual facilities, coffee/tea maker, iron, tv, etc. Beds were soft, big and comfortable. Not bad for $110 a night!
reviews.title: Well located basic hotel

reviews.text: No breakfest is provided, but there's plenty of diner's and cafe's around so that didn't pose much of a problem.
reviews.title: Good location; OK accommodation; watch for extra charges

reviews.text: The location is oK, the staff was all very friendly.
reviews.title: questionable neighbors

reviews.text: We went with our daughter to scout colleges in Boston after a long day on campus tours we went to bed at about 11pm at about midnight it started . We had prostitutes next door. Unbelievably loud. We heard them arguing for 1/2 an hour then the bed going for half an hour etc...... There is no way the staff could not have noticed a parade of people coming through at this hour.
reviews.title: Great Boston hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Midtown hotel for 5 nights this previous week, I must say that I was attracted by its location as much as anything.
reviews.title: Great location. Great value. Great staff. A great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival I was greeted by a very friendly concierge who offer to assist me with my baggage upon arrival. Check in was quick and easy and I was directed to my room down the hall. Some people may be put off by the long corridors, to me it was not bothersome.
reviews.title: What is that smell??

reviews.text: I arrived in my room to find it very clean, spacious and well equipped for my stay. With a 32 inch HD tv to compliment the room I felt right at home. There is ample room to hang clothes and store them in drawers which I found very useful. The room had a fantastic view of the Prudential center and Huntington Ave. All in all I was very impressed with the room.
reviews.title: Great for a fun night in Boston!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Midtown Hotel for 3 nights. Location is great - near shopping malls, 5 mins walk from a subway station, approx 25 mins walk to Boston Common and Downtown area. The outside of the building is really unattractive and the corridors are poorly lit with stained carpets so we didn't get a great first impression. However the room was huge with 2 double beds and a sofa. It was clean and well maintained. The bathroom was small but had a good power shower. There is no restaurant for breakfast but there is a cafe down the road. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel and I think it is good value for a trip where you will be spending most of your time sightseeing.
reviews.title: Fine for a short break to Boston

reviews.text: This was first stop on a touring holiday of New England/New York. It was on the whole, OK. No real complaints. No restaurant , but plenty of places round about and since we were a group, they put on breakfast for us. Again OK. There were certainly lots of places round about to sample the local delicacies such as Clam Chowder and very affordable lobster. The hotel was very clean and my bedroom was huge, with two double beds.
reviews.title: Adore Boston

reviews.text: Where to start with an opinion of the Midtown Hotel? Well, the room rate was excellent and the location convenient for the stay required. Newbury Street, the Purdential Building, Boston Symphony, and subway station are all within walking distance. A subway Aside from this the experience was less than stellar. The parking, while available is limited. The hotel’s décor is dated. The carpet looks old and dirty to the point we elected not to walk in bare feet. The first morning there, a family member awoke to find a large roach stuck under their suitcase. This did not reinforce our comfort level with the hotel. Well not unexpected, the street noise is really bad. If people on the sidewalk stopped or were talking on the phone outside our room window their conversations were completely audible. Sirens throughout the night felt and sounded as though they would come right through the room. At one point a family member paid $2.00 for a bottle soda from a vending machine. They stated it tasted poorly, and alas the expiration date had come and gone. A computer in the lobby requires a credit card and WiFi is a charge, too. If one is looking for inexpensive, convenient accomodations in Boston the Midtown might work. If comfort, cleanliness and sleep quality are important perhaps pay more and expect more.
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.text: What a value! We chose to stay here for the price and location when we went to a concert in Boston. I got a lot more than I expected for the price. Staff was welcoming the minute we walked thru the door. Our room was "clean!" I am that person who looks for the unknown hair on the floor or dirty (skeevy) blankets and I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness. The cleanliness is the reason for this review, staff would be second, and you can't beat the location! I will most definately recommend to everyone I know that is looking for clean, convenient, welcoming hotel this is it...the best bang for your buck in Boston!!! Thank you Mark at the front dest - you were wonderful
reviews.title: BEST value for your buck in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was aware of the comments previously written about this hotel, but can honestly say that the hotel is clean, rooms are spacious and the hotel was handy for the subway. The desk staff are pleasant as are the housekeeping staff. We had booked for 11 nights and the first 7 were uneventfull, however on the 8th night we were kept awake till 3am by the room above us. My husband complained to the front desk and the noise did go down a little, and eventually at 5:30 it stopped. There were 3 groups booked into the hotel that day, one of them being high school kids who come to Boston for Uni visits. The next night was slightly better but the layout of the hotel is over 2 floors and there was an exit door at the end of the corridor which can be accessed 24 hrs, meaning that guests can come in this door without going past the front desk- resulting in many young people going past your room at all hours-noisy. I spoke with the manager on the second morning asking if the group leaders could remind their groups that other guests were staying in the hotel, and he informed me that the group was checking out that day- hurrah. However when we arrived back that evening another group of kids were checking in- my husband spoke to a very understanding girl at the desk, who said that this group were in rooms all over the hotel, but she could move us to another room at the back of the hotel which would be quieter. We then had the last 2 nights in peace. So I would recommend that if you intend to stay here in March/ April- ask for a quiet room. Apart from this one incident I would recommend thhis hotel.
reviews.title: Good value for money-but beware large groups staying

reviews.text: Enjoyed our stay. Service was exceptional. Walking distance to Fenway Park and a short cab ride away from downtown!
reviews.title: Great service, cleanliness and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been at this hotel year ago in with my husband for one week.The room was very clean,large and bed very comfortable.The staff was very friendly too.The location was good for this price.Next year i plan to go Boston,so will stay the same hotel.
reviews.title: ''Great place in Boston''

reviews.text: Just returned from a six night stay in Boston. And what a fine city it is as well!
reviews.title: What a Little Gem!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having decided to get away for a few days, i thought it was time to heed my brothers advice and book a trip to Boston. He only had good things to say about it, so i thought it was time to find out for myself especialy as i'd never been before.
reviews.title: Good overall for price

reviews.text: I have to say i was rather alarmed at the prices of hotels there, and it was as much for this reason that i decided to book The Midtown. All other options were too expensive!!
reviews.title: horrid housekeeping

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed here the weekend of the Pats-Jets game. Great locations - right by the Prudential Centre and its subway stop (which takes you directly to the Boston Common, and the start of the Freedom Trail) and the Back Bay Station (which we used to take the Patriots Train to Gillette Stadium). Lots of restaurant, pubs and the college-age crowd. Rooms were HUGE with lots of drawer space. Some people have commented on the odd bathroom design (the sink is outside of the bathroom) but I personally found it handy to have access to the sink while my friend was showering. Staff was professional and courteous. I did not use the internet at all while there so I have no comments about it. It was easy to get to the hotel and to exit Boston (we were driving).
reviews.title: Great location; no complaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint are the thin walls! You can hear everything in the other rooms!
reviews.title: Worth every penny and then some!

reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical about staying in this hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews here..but $89 a night in its location? I couldn't beat it anywhere. So I gave it a shot, and was pleasantly surprised. We arrived and parked in the convenient garage below the hotel and went to check in. I guess it is normally $18 dollars a night to park but if you are going to a sporting event (we were going to see the Bruins) the parking is free.
reviews.title: Great location but not sorth $90 a night!

reviews.text: We reserved a standard king on the first floor with a street view, and were quickly checked in by the front desk staff who were beyond nice.
reviews.title: The midtown Hotel

reviews.text: We went up to our room and were very skeptical at this point, the hallways were long and confusing, and very poorly lit. So we made it to our room and we were very impressed! The rooms must have had an overhaul because a lot of people said the furniture and decor was out dated..not so much in our room. It was a very large room with a nice table with chairs, modern looking lamps and a 32" HDTV! With options to order a movie. So DONT pay attention to the older photos in this review..it was a very nice room. The bathroom was very small but very clean..I mean come on, its not like we are going to be sleeping in there! The bed was freshly made and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place, Location, service

reviews.text: This hotel is definitely no frills and somewhat dated in it's decor but it is very clean and very close to shopping, dining and transportation. The staff is so very helpful and dedicated to seeing to the needs of guests. The price is very reasonable for the area also. Parking is available also. Staying at this property was an overall good experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful Helpful & Friendly Staff

reviews.text: This hotel was gross. It looked like it had not been updated since the series finale of The Brady Bunch. Bed was terribly uncomfortable with awful bedding. Cigaratte burns? Really? Very thin walls, very noisy place. Busses outside left running. Fumes. Ick. Very uncomfortable and I'll never stay here again.
reviews.title: Only stay here is you're desperate

reviews.text: If your coming to Boston and need a place to stay with out taking a bite out of you wallet , The Midtown Hotel is the best deal in town. The staff is helpful with plenty of knowledge of Boston and what it can offer.. I have stayed with them several times and never had a bad stay..... Check them out..........PS
reviews.title: Great Place In the Heart of Boston !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel during March for a couple of days while visiting Boston.
reviews.title: Good hotel, a little bit old fashioned

reviews.text: The hotel is good, it seems that it might have been a very good business hotel like 20 years ago, but now the place looks as if we were in 1980.
reviews.title: Price and location make up for thin walls.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Midtown on a freezing, snowy week in March 08.
reviews.title: Bargain Basic - Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel was warm, clean and suited our budget perfectly. I did a lot of research and realised that we favoured location over luxury as we were going to be out exploring most of the day. The front desk staff were efficient and the old guy trying to sell theme tickets at the door was a sweetie. The airport shuttle service was great and picked us up right at the hotel door.
reviews.title: 1960's Los Angeles

likes.disliked: — The hallways are very long and a little dark

description: Centrally located in downtown Boston, The Midtown Hotel blends comfort and convenience with affordability. This moderately priced hotel, nestled in the heart of Boston’s Back Bay. Just steps away from The Prudential Center, Copley Place and the Hynes Convention Center this downtown hotel is near three subway stops on both the green and orange lines. Nearby Fenway Park, The Museum of Fine Arts, Symphony Hall, and the elegant restaurants and boutique shops of Newbury Street make Boston an exciting city to visit and The Midtown Hotel the place to stay.
